0.Name: Take a 10-minute walk:
0.Description: If you don't exercise at all, a brief walk is a great way to start. If you do, it's a good way to add more exercise to your day.

1.Name: Give yourself a lift:
1.Description: Lifting a hardcover book or a two-pound weight a few times a day can help tone your arm muscles. When that becomes a breeze, move on to heavier items or join a gym.

2.Name: Eat one extra fruit or vegetable a day:
2.Description: Fruits and vegetables are inexpensive, taste good, and are good for everything from your brain to your bowels.

3.Name: Make breakfast count:
3.Description: Start the day with some fruit and a serving of whole grains, like oatmeal, bran flakes, or whole-wheat toast.

4.Name: Stop drinking your calories:
4.Description: Cutting out just one sugar-sweetened soda or calorie-laden latte can easily save you 100 or more calories a day. Over a year, that can translate into a 10-pound weight loss.

5.Name: Have a handful of nuts:
5.Description: Walnuts, almonds, peanuts, and other nuts are good for your heart. Try grabbing some instead of chips or cookies when you need a snack, adding them to salads for a healthful and tasty crunch, or using them in place of meat in pasta and other dishes.

6.Name: Sample the fruits of the sea:
6.Description: Eat fish or other types of seafood instead of red meat once a week. It's good for the heart, the brain, and the waistline.

7.Name: Breathe deeply:
7.Description: Try breathing slowly and deeply for a few minutes a day. It can help you relax. Slow, deep breathing may also help lower blood pressure.
